trigger: The Legionella pneumophila <extra_id_0> rpoS <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> gene is required for growth within Acanthamoeba castellanii .

To investigate regulatory networks in Legionella pneumophila , the gene encoding the homolog of the Escherichia coli stress and stationary-phase sigma factor <extra_id_0> RpoS <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> was identified by complementation of an E . coli <extra_id_0> rpoS <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> mutation .
An open reading frame that is approximately 60 % identical to the E . coli <extra_id_0> rpoS <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> gene was identified .
Western blot analysis showed that the level of L . pneumophila <extra_id_0> RpoS <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> increased in stationary phase .

An insertion mutation was constructed in the <extra_id_0> rpoS <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> gene on the chromosome of L . pneumophila , and the ability of this mutant strain to survive various stress conditions was assayed and compared with results for the wild-type strain .
Both the mutant and wild-type strains were more resistant to stress when in stationary phase than when in the logarithmic phase of growth .
This finding indicates that L . pneumophila <extra_id_0> RpoS <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> is not required for a stationary-phase - dependent resistance to stress .
Although the mutant strain was able to kill HL-60 - and THP-1 - derived macrophages , it could not replicate within a protozoan host , Acanthamoeba castellanii .

These data suggest that L . pneumophila possesses a growth phase - dependent resistance to stress that is independent of <extra_id_0> RpoS <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> control and that <extra_id_0> RpoS <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> likely regulates genes that enable it to survive in the environment within protozoa .

Our data indicate that the role of <extra_id_0> rpoS <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> in L . pneumophila is very different from what has previously been reported for E . coli <extra_id_0> rpoS <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> .
